description:
Senior Sponsorship Sales Manager

Location: London Victoria

The International Quality and Productivity Centre (IQPC) are devoted to creating and executing content driven B2B events for senior executives globally. We are an entrepreneurial business and a market leader recently celebrating our 50-year anniversary. With offices in New York, Toronto, Sydney, Berlin and Singapore, every year we deliver around 1500 events across the globe.

People are IQPC's most important asset, everything we do is a product of our people, and our competitive advantage is based on our ability to hire the best people, develop them in the right way and offer them the most exciting opportunities.

The Division

Customer Contact Week Europe (CCW Europe) is the region’s leading analyst and industry network to the Customer Management community. With a cross industry focus, representing practitioners from leading Enterprises we focus on the following practise areas:

- Customer Contact

- Customer Experience

- Employee Engagement & Experience

Our speaker faculties include Executive Leadership of the regions leading B2C companies such as HSBC, JPMorgan Chase, ASOS, New Balance , and Uber. Our Celebrity Headliners include world renowned pioneers such as Baroness Karren Brady of Knightsbridge, Jo Malone CBE, Peter Schmeichel , Lord Sebastian Coe, Michel Roux Jr., David Coulthard and Sir Ranulph Fiennes

By bringing together these Senior Executives at a time when they are reviewing their strategic priorities, we create an unrivalled platform for our Sponsor Partners to elevate their brand and build near-term business development opportunities. Our Sponsor Partners span the worlds leading consultancies, SaaS and BPO providers.

The Position

The Sponsorship Sales Manager will be responsible for securing sponsorship revenue on our international events and digital marketing platform. You will be working on multiple events over the course of the year and will be expected to grow revenue from a base of existing clients whilst also sourcing new business.

Sponsorship Sales Manager Requirements
• Maintain a thorough understanding of our products and the industry
• Maintain regular contact with clients and formulate innovative, creative and profitable solutions for their business
• Maintain close liaison with the marketing, production and operations teams in order to ensure the delivery of successful customer focused events
• Identify potential customers from competitive media, events and from other business sources

The Ideal Candidate
• A highly ambitious individual who is looking for a career move
• A track record in business to business sales (ideally sponsorship or media sales)
• A solid sales process and/or previous sales training
• Business acumen and strong commercial awareness
• Ability to communicate with a wide range of clients at all levels of seniority
• A desire to develop themselves as a sales professional
